paper_abstract: In this paper, we show the relationship between the two most widely used approaches for the minimization of deterministic finite automata: minimization by split of partitions and minimization by double reversal. Even though the double reversal approach has usually been considered to be unconventional with respect to the more common split approach, we show that any double reversal minimization algorithm can be related to a split minimization algorithm and vice versa. (C) 2015 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: DFA minimization: Double reversal versus split minimization algorithms
